alert.note: Alert for North St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. Louis County through 515 PM CDT... At 500 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over western Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, or 23 miles northwest of Ely, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern St. Louis County, including the following locations... Lac la Croix, Lake Agnes, Crooked Lake and Loon Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
